chapter_title: Long Range Flight and Polar Navigation

questions.question: How should the accuracy of long range navigation systems be checked?
options: With 2 systems, a voting system is employed
With reference to a map and compass
A voting system if 3 systems are installed, by cross-checking with DME with only 2 systems
questions.solution: A voting system if 3 systems are installed, by cross-checking with DME with only 2 systems

questions.question: If an aircraft is unable to continue in accordance with the clearance what should they do?
options: Attempt to obtain a revised clearance from ATC, via radio relay if required
Continue in accordance with the last acknowledged clearance until in sight of land
Follow the contrails of another aircraft
Land at the nearest suitable aerodrome
questions.solution: Attempt to obtain a revised clearance from ATC, via radio relay if required

questions.question: An aircraft on the ground at latitude 51°50'S is parked on a heading of 180° with ground power applied and all flight instruments powered. After 2 hours, what will the DGI indicate?
What is a minimum time route?
options: The great circle track between 2 points
The minimum time between 2 points taking into account wind and time zone changes
The minimum time between 2 points taking into account wind and ATC restrictions
questions.solution: The minimum time between 2 points taking into account wind and ATC restrictions
